title: Can't use Google Authenticator (Android) for Firefox Account's 2FA
content:
Hi,

As in the topic. When I scan the QR code with Google Authenticator, the account is added and new codes start spinning (labeled Firefox ($email)). However, when I enter the visible code into the Enter security code input, I get "Incorrect security code" error (tooltip).

I can see Google Authenticator listed as a supported application, is this no longer valid?

I also tried typing the secret key into the app directly with the same results.

Thanks for help in advance.
creator: robin92pl

title: Web pages that do not support HTTP2 are initiated by HTTP2 requests, resulting in access failures
content: URL：https://www.meituan.com/flight/ https://awp-assets.meituan.net/hfe/rohr/1.0.2/rohr.min.js #第一次访问正常 使用HTTP1.1 刷新后会使用http2 导致访问失败。实际此域名不支持HTTP2， 404 是CDN的问题可以忽略，怀疑是浏览器BUG

title: While browsing I opened a tab expecting to see my rows of top sites, those I edited.
content:
While browsing I opened a tab so I could view my "Top Sites" and click on one of them I wanted to visit. They are all gone. There should be three rows, most of which I have edited to the sites I visit most. The option is still checked, with three rows being how many are shown. It is just a blank tab. Nothing is there anymore. Any help would be appreciated. Thank you.

Betty
creator: irrilia

title: Firefox manual accessibility focus concern with embedded YouTube video
content:
When using the Firefox browser to navigate the links on this page using the TAB key, https://www.utrgv.edu/police/ there is something that receives focus after the last link "FAQ" on the Departments section on the bottom left side when the focus enters the embedded YouTube video that is not announced using the NVDA screen reader or visible on the screen. A second TAB key press shows the animated subscribe button.

I'm using the latest version of Firefox (86.0) on Windows 10.

Chrome and other browsers show visible activity - animating the subscribe button - when using the TAB key to switch focus from the FAQ link to the embedded video.

Thanks, Russell
creator: russell.dove

title: Ultima actualizacion 86.0 Consume el 99% de RAM
content: Anteriormente ya habia pasado, creo que en la actualizacion 84.2 pero lo solucionaron en la actualizacion siguiente. Firefoz consume el 99%-100% de la RAM del equipo progresivamente, hasta congelar el equipo forzando a apagarlo. La unica forma de solucionarlo es : iniciando en modo seguro Creando nuevo perfil o borando todos los datos (cosa que no quiero hacer para no perder el historial, marcadores y contraseñas) Ya habia redactado mas detalles, pero claro, lo tipico no se envia el reporte y tienes que volver a escribir todo. Solo espero puedan solucionar este problema por que es muy molesto estar en modo seguro
creator: scrat_juan

title: SHA256 checksum for Firefox downloads
content: In order to mitigate supply chain attacks it would be useful to have a checksum published so that we can verify the file has downloaded appropriately. This should be included within the release notes.
creator: linden1

title: How do i access the HTML code for my old thimble project?
content:
Im trying to access the HTML code i created on thimble back in 2018 but apparently Thimble he shit down and moved to glitch.

How do i transfer/access this code? This link (https://glitch.happyfox.com/kb/article/7-how-do-i-move-my-project-from-thimble-to-glitch/) says to contact the mozilla support team and i looked for an email but this place was the only support page i found.
creator: kyalsimm

title: multiple instances of firefox, but should only be one..
content:
I discovered this issue this evening, no idea how long it's been going on. I opened Task Manager to see if a program was running (not firefox) . Firefox WAS open, and I had one window open in firefox.. BUT next to Firefox, was (7) so I expanded. It showed 7 instances. With only 2 programs open, (firefox and task Manager) the amount of memory it was using was surprising.. Using 64 bit version of Firefox, 86.0

I tried "ending task" on the instances that were using 0% CPU, but I was only able to close 2-3 before ALL of them closed. I would then reopen and it would be 6, 7, or 8 instances I tried 3 times. 

Can someone enlighten me as to why it is doing this?

Screenshot below
creator: irishangel61

title: Duplicate Bookmarks
content:
All was well. Then suddenly two, three, and more bookmarks and folders began to spontaneously duplicate. Some as many as ten or more times. Some of the folders are empty, while others with the same name have the links. What is happening and how do I stop it?

Thank you.

I have also tried this in a private window, on Google Chrome and on my phone and the same thing happens.
